stories.text:
Hey HN! I'm Richie from Fella (www.joinfella.com), a telehealth clinic for men with obesity. We match fellas with a board-certified obesity doctor to prescribe an FDA-approved medication, and also match them with a psychological coach to tackle emotion-driven overeating.

I personally struggled in private with stress eating for 6 years [1]. During that time, I was at Cambridge University then built and sold my first company working with the UK government. It was stressful, and poor eating habits as a teenager became a coping mechanism as an adult.

Fella first started as a CBT+community product to help men struggling with stress eating. It resonated due to the stigma around men's eating struggles. But we realized we were only half-serving most of our customers: even when no longer stress eating, most guys weren't getting to a healthier weight.

So we started researching about effective, evidence-backed treatments for obesity.

When I say "we", I really mean my co-founder Luke. He studied medicine at Cambridge University before transitioning into digital health, developing a patented AI approach to detecting cancer at a YC bio company, before moving to Microsoft Research. He parses bio papers better than me...

We learned that obesity treatment is about to radically change due to a breakthrough medication — NY Times called it a "game changer" in Feb 2021 [2]. The medication was FDA approved in June 2021 [3]. Main paper [4] and summary of phase 3 trials [5] are at the bottom of this post. But we also learned a medication-based approach is still stigmatized and hard to access.

So we pivoted to the Fella you see today: a telehealth experience with a board-certified obesity doctor for FDA-approved medication, and 1-on-1 psychological coaching to address emotion-driven overeating. We went live in Texas in July and are soon to be live in California & New York. Fella costs $149/month, paid quarterly.

We all know why obesity is a difficult problem to solve: for the vast majority of people willpower is not enough in today's world. The deeper causes of obesity (metabolic issues & emotion-driven eating) are mostly overlooked by the weight loss industry and family doctors, who focus too much on "eat less, move more".

Why our solution is needed: 1. Medication-assisted treatment for obesity is still stigmatized and hard to access. 2. Stress eating is wildly prevalent among bigger guys, but it's rarely recognized as a problem and there is a perception that eating struggles are a "woman thing" — so men often don't seek help. 3. Men represent only 10% of those using weight management services despite men representing 50% of those with obesity. Almost all programs market to women, often placing too much emphasis on looks and not enough on health for a male audience.

We still have lots of difficulties ahead. The main one could be insurance reimbursement: the latest wave of medications are expensive and insurers don't like to cover them [6].

We’re excited to hear your ideas, questions, concerns, feedback — and maybe any personal stories. I’ll be responding to comments all day, or please feel free to shoot me an email at richie@joinfella.com.

[1] https://www.itv.com/news/anglia/2020-11-09/cambridge-graduate-who-ate-10k-calories-in-1-day-starts-online-eating-disorders-support-network

[2] https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/10/health/obesity-weight-loss-drug-semaglutide.html

[3] https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/fda-approves-new-drug-treatment-chronic-weight-management-first-2014

[4] https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMoa2032183

[5] https://www.thelancet.com/journals/landia/article/PIIS2213-8587(21)00081-4/fulltext

[6] https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2021-07-19/weight-loss-drug-wegovy-could-help-millions-will-insurers-buy-in
